com.snap2d.world

Class GLWorld2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snap2d.world.World2D
      • com.snap2d.world.GLWorld2D

  • public final class GLWorld2D
extends World2D
    Implementation of World2D for use with OpenGL coordinate system. This implementation removes World2D's y-axis inversion and does not round Point conversions between world space and screen space since OpenGL accepts float and double values for vertex coordinates. Use of this class is entirely optional with OpenGL since the orthographic projection matrix can take care of the same transformation between world-space and the screen viewport.
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

      • convertWorldRect

        public Rectangle convertWorldRect(Rect2D r)
        Converts the given Rect2D representing bounds in world space to corresponding Rectangle bounds in screen space. This method first converts the x,y coordinates, then scales the rectangle by this World2D's current pixels-per-unit value.
